comment: I LOVED Dr. McCoy. I was quarantined multiple times throughout the semester and he was so accommodating. He is seriously the sweetest man. Only 3 essays and some little free writes. If you need to be in a class that has structure, dont take him. He is an amazing professor but his D2L and his assignments are all over the place, lol.

This class is the easiest class I have ever and will ever take. He is so sweet and a really easy grader. Only thing is, he doesn't put grades in D2L and his due dates are sometimes confusing. We had 3 essays and some free writes, but none of it is too bad. If you're ok with not having structure but getting a good grade, take him.

Attendance was mandatory but he usually let us out 30min early. My only issue with him was that he never gave clear due dates. If you need a class with structure hes not for you, but hes a super easy grader and we only had 3 essays. He does make us read our writings out loud though
This professor was a joy to have!! only 3 papers and free writes to do during class! not a challenging class at all and he was so kind and understanding! would 100% take again!
His is a very sweet teacher. He will not fail you. Just do the work and you will pass it is a very easy class. He sends your grades on email. I would definitely take him again

His class is really easy with only a few papers and some assignments on the book, but he does not reply to his emails at all, has no grade in D2L, has to send assignments through email, and doesn't hear anything or feedback or what grade I got. He his class is really easy but don't expect a grade in the class until the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: You won't fail. Do the work, Essays once a week, every week. Very loose with prompts. Doesn't give rubrics or anything, just random prompts. Not hard, if you want to just get this class out the way, take this class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor McCoy's class was ridiculously easy! As long as you do the occasional reading from the textbook and write the three papers for the class, you'll get an A. Deadlines are flexible and he never penalized us for late work. You are able to work at your own pace in the semester. He takes attendance every class but it does not affect your grade.

Every class has a 7-minute writing which has already improved my writing. He cancels class often. Very nice man who truly cares about his students although, he hasn't challenged me in the slightest. Only 4 papers all semester. The majority of classes is used for people to read aloud their 7-minute writings. Lets class out early often.

He's an amazing professor! He didn't know how to work the discussion board, so we had to send him emails. He usually responds within a few days at most. He's very understanding about COVID. I didn't know my grade until after the midterm and at the end of the semester, so make sure to turn all your work in. I'd definitely take him again if I could.

Dr. McCoy is great! Very kind! Responds to emails fairly quickly and answers all questions! Gives great feedback! Only had to write 3 easy papers for the whole semester. Attendance was graded each week by just emailing him a question abt the assignment given. You need the textbook for the assignment given but can find it for free online. TAKE HIM!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: If you want an A in english 1102, take him. McCoy lets you out of class early almost everyday and is very lenient with his essay grading. 4 essays and thats the class and you get lots of time to work on them. TAKE HIM if you can!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Professor McCoy was great. He cares about his students and our grades!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Each class consisted of a 7-minute writing and then the class shared what they wrote (only if you wanted). This class is an easy A, there were only 3 essays (first essay, midterm, final), and all the Journal Entries were due with the midterm and final essay. No quizzes, and no tests.
